page.title: 13Shawforth Moorland Sports :1
page.content:
The moors of Shawforth attract a number of sports. Hang gliders hover over Hades Hill, motor cycle trials riders negotiate the difficult quarry and moorland terrain and Land Rovers lurch at seemingly impossible angles in their attempt to out manoeuvre their opponents in time trials events.
{Motor Cycle Trials} The first Red Rose National Motor Cycle Trial was held in Shawforth in 1957 and in subsequent years up to 1966. After a lapse of 9 years it was held in Shawforth again and has been run there ever since. The event begins at Landgate, Shawforth and covers 18 miles of rugged moorland circuit and quarries, stretching as far south as Healey Corner, Whitworth. The event attracts riders from as far away as Grantham, Redruth and Birmingham.
